gurmukhi: ਕਹਾ ਠੳੁਰ ਤਿਹ ਸ਼ੱਤ੍ਰੁ ਕੀ ਕਹੋ ਰਿਖਨ ਕੇ ਰਾਜ || ਮੋਹਿ ਬਤਾਵੈ ਜਾਹਿ ਕੳੁ ਤਾਹਿ ਹਨੋ ਹੳੁ ਅਾਜ ||੨੩੯੩||
transliteration: Kahaa Thaur Tih Shattr(u) Kikaho Rikhan Ke Raaj|| Mohe Bataavai Jaah(i) Kau Taah(i) Hano Hau Aaj||2393||
translation: “O sages! where does that enemy live? Tell me his place, so that I may kill him today.”2393.

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ੲਿਕ ਰਿਖ ਨੇ ਜਾੲਿ ਬਤਾਯੋ || ਜਹਾਂ ਠੳੁਰ ਹੋ ਸ਼ੱਤ੍ਰੁ ਬਨਾਯੋ || ਜਹ ਬਲਧਰਿ ਸੋ ਸ਼ੱਤ੍ਰ ਨਿਹਾਰਯੋ || ਹਮ ਸੰਗ ਲਰਿ ੲਿਹ ਭਾਂਤਿ ਪਚਾਰਯੋ ||੨੩੯੪||
transliteration: Tab Ik Rikh Na Jaae Bataayo|| Jahaan Thaur Ho Shatr(u) Banaayo|| Jah Baldhar(i) So Shattra Nihdaryo|| Hma San Lar (i) Eh Bhaant(i) Pachdaryo||2394||
translation: Then one of the sages showed him the place, where the enemy was living; Balram saw the enemy; and challenged him for fighting.2394.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਨਤ ਬਚਨ ਤਬ ਸ਼ੱਤ੍ਰੁ ਰਿਸਾਯੋ || ਹਾਥ ਗਾਂਗਨੋ ਯਾ ਪਰਿ ਅਾਯੋ || ਹਲਧਰਿ ਸੰਗ ਜੁਧ ਯਾ ਕਯੋ || ਜਿਹ ਸਮ ਅੳੁਰ ਬੀਰ ਨਹੀ ਹਯੋ ||੨੩੯੫||
transliteration: Sounat Bachanndtab Shattr(u) Risaayo|| Haath Gadngno Yaa Par(i) Aayo|| Haldhar(i) San Judh Yaa Kayo|| Jih Sam Aur Beer Nahihayo||2395||
translation: Hearing the challenge, the enemy was infuriated and on this side, these people, with the signs of their hands, told Balram everything; that enemy fought the battle with Balram; there has been no mughty warrior like Balram.2395.

gurmukhi: ਬਹੁਤ ਜੁੱਧ ਤਿਹ ਠਾਂ ਦੁਹੂੰ ਧਾਰੋ || ਦੁਹੂ ਸੂਰ ਤੇ ੲੇਕ ਨ ਹਾਰੋ || ਜੳੁ ਥਕਿ ਜਾਹਿ ਬੈਠ ਤਹ ਰਹੈ || ਮੁੱਛਤ ਹੋਹ ਜੁੱਧੁ ਫਿਰ ਚਹੈ ||੨੩੯੬||
transliteration: Bahout Jauddh Tih Thaan Duhoon Ddaro|| Duhoo Soor Te Ek Na Daro|| Jau Thak(i) Jaah(i) Baith Tah Rahai|| Mouchchhat Hoh Judhh(u) Phir Chahai||2396||
translation: A dreadful battle was fought at that place, and none of both the warriors was defeated; they would sit when they felt tired and on becoming unconscious, they expressed their wish to continued fighting.2396.

gurmukhi: ਫਿਰ ਦੋੳੂ ਗਾਜ ਗਾਜ ਰਨ ਪਾਰੈ || ਅਾਪਸਿ ਬੀਚ ਗਦਾ ਬਹੁ ਮਾਰੈ || ਠਾਢ ਰਹੈ ਥਿਰੁ ਪੈਗ ਨ ਟਰੈ || ਮਾਨਹੁ ਰਿਸ ਪਰਬਤ ਦੋੳੂ ਲਰੈ ||੨੩੯੭||
transliteration: Phir Dooo Gadj Ran Pdarai|| Oopas(i) Beech Gadaa Bahu Mdarai|| Thaadh Rahai Thir(u) Paig(u) Na Darai|| Maanoh Ris Parbat Dooo Darai||2397||
translation: Then again they thundered and continued the fight and began to strike their maces on each other; they were stable and did not recede even one step; it seemed that two mountains were fighting against each other.2397.

gurmukhi: ਦੋੳੂ ਭਟ ਅਭ੍ਰਨ ਜਿੳੁ ਗਾਜੈ || ਬਚਨ ਸੁਨਤ ਜਿਨ ਕੈ ਜਮ ਲਾਜੈ || ਅਤਿ ਹੀ ਬੀਰ ਰਿਸਹਿ ਮੈ ਭਰੇ || ਦੋੳੂ ਬੀਰ ਕ੍ਰੋਧ ਸੋ ਲਰੇ ||੨੩੯੮||
transliteration: Dooo Bhat Abhran Ji Gadjai|| Bachanndsounat Jin Kai Jam Laajai|| At(i) Hibeer Risah(i) Mai Bhare|| Dooo Beer Krodh So Dare||2398||
translation: Both the warriors were thundering like clouds, hearing their voices, even Yama got fearful; both the warriors were fighting with each other filled with anger.2398.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਨ ਕੳੁਤਕ ਦੇਖਨ ਸੁਰ ਅਾੲੇ || ਭਾਂਤਿਨ ਭਾਂਤਿ ਬਿਵਾਨ ਬਨਾੲੇ || ੳੁਤ ਰੰਭਾਦਿਕ ਨ੍ਰਿੱਤਹ ਕਰੈ || ੲਿਤ ਤੇ ਬੀਰ ਭੂਮ ਮੈ ਲਰੈ ||੨੩੯੯||
transliteration: Jin Kaoutak Dekhan Sur Aae|| Bhaant(i) Bivaan Banaae|| Out Ranbhaadik Nrittah Darai|| It Te Beer Bhoom Mai Darai||2399||
translation: In order to see this wonderful spectacle, even the gods came in their various types of air-vehicles; on that side the heavenly damsel like Rambha began to dance and on this side, these warriors were fighting on the earth.2399.

gurmukhi: ਬਹੁਤ ਗਦਾ ਤਨ ਲਗੈ ਨ ਜਾਨੈ || ਮੁਖ ਤੇ ਮਾਰ ਹੀ ਮਾਰ ਬਖਾਨੈ || ਰਨ ਕੀ ਛਿਤ ਤੇ ਪੈਗ ਨ ਟਰੈ || ਰੀਝ ਰੀਝ ਦੋੳੂ ਭਟ ਲਰੈ ||੨੪੦੦||
transliteration: Bahout Gadaa Tan Lagad Na Jaanai|| Moukh Te Maar Himaar Bakhaanai|| Ram Kichhit Te Paig Na Darai|| Rijh Reejh Rreejh Dooo Bhat Darai||2400||
translation: They were not caring for the blows of the maces and were uttering the shouts of “kill, kill” from their mouths; they were not receding even one step in the battlefield and both of them were fighting delightfully.2400.
